source.name: 8.1 what is an action

answers.answer: Custom Python code the bot can execute

source.learningObjectives: SWBAT define what an Action is in Rasa
source.guidance: The correct answer is: Custom Python code the bot can execute. Actions are Python classes that execute custom code. They allow the bot to do more than just send static text - they can perform calculations, access databases, and execute any Python logic. The other options are incorrect: predefined bot messages are responses (utter_*), conversation scripts are flows, and configuration files are separate YAML files used for bot setup.
